title: How to Use Chives

steps.headline: Grow your own chives.
steps.description: If you'd like to have them freshly available, chives grow well outdoors and indoors, and are happy in a container.

steps.headline: Use chives to replace parsley.
steps.description: The mildness of the onion flavour is not overwhelming and chives can make an excellent spicier substitute for parsley in many a dish.

steps.headline: Use chives with egg and cheese dishes.
Cut chives up into smaller pieces and add to salads.
steps.description: Chives in salad is an ideal addition. Use the chive flowers in salads. They are a pretty addition.

steps.headline: Sprinkle over baked potatoes.
steps.description: Bake the potatoes, slice them open, add a dollop of sour cream or cream cheese and sprinkle over with cut chives. This also works well as a combination used over steamed or boiled corn.

steps.headline: Make a sandwich with chives inside.

text: Grow your own chives. If you'd like to have them freshly available, chives grow well outdoors and indoors, and are happy in a container. Use chives to replace parsley. The mildness of the onion flavour is not overwhelming and chives can make an excellent spicier substitute for parsley in many a dish. Use chives with egg and cheese dishes. These are a perfect match. Cut chives up into smaller pieces and add to salads. Chives in salad is an ideal addition. Use the chive flowers in salads. They are a pretty addition. Sprinkle over baked potatoes. Bake the potatoes, slice them open, add a dollop of sour cream or cream cheese and sprinkle over with cut chives. This also works well as a combination used over steamed or boiled corn. Make a sandwich with chives inside. Spread cream cheese across the bread and sprinkle with cut chives. Add chives to homemade bread. Chop into small pieces as shown in the image.
